awd_titl_txt: Partial Support of the 1988 Lattice Gauge Symposium,        Batavia, Illinois, September 22-25, 1988 (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: This project is the sixth in a series of international                     conferences on Lattice Gauge Theories.  These are numerical                     approximations to coupled field equations for interaction of                    fundamental particles, an approach that has grown rapidly with                  the advances in computer power of the last decade and has grown                 in importance to elementary particle theory.                                         This Conference should be of material benefit in increasing                the rate of progress in the field.  In particular, it may help                  bring closer the goal of making predictions for the mass of the                 "Higgs Boson" an as yet undiscovered particle that plays a                      central role in particle theory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
